title: Fix infinite loop causing maximum update depth exceeded error

requirements.text: Identify and fix the infinite setState loop in the Dashboard component that occurs when the onFilteredOrdersChange callback is triggered, causing a maximum update depth exceeded error

quotes: Maximum update depth exceeded. This can happen when a component repeatedly calls setState inside componentWillUpdate or componentDidUpdate. React limits the number of nested updates to prevent infinite loops

acceptanceCriteria: Tab switching works without triggering infinite loops
SummaryCards update correctly when filtered orders change
No maximum update depth exceeded errors in console

requirements.text: Ensure the onFilteredOrdersChange callbacks in TotalOrdersTab, ReadyTab, HallmarkTab, and CustomerOrdersTab do not cause parent component re-renders that retrigger the same callbacks
acceptanceCriteria: Callbacks are properly memoized or stabilized
Filtered orders state updates do not cause cascading re-renders
Each tab's filtering logic executes exactly once per filter change

requirements.text: Add proper dependency arrays and memoization (useMemo/useCallback) to prevent unnecessary effect re-executions in the Dashboard and tab components
acceptanceCriteria: useEffect hooks have correct dependency arrays
Callback functions passed as props are wrapped in useCallback
Filtered data calculations use useMemo where appropriate
No unnecessary re-renders detected in React DevTools

constraints: Do not change the data flow architecture where tabs filter orders and pass results to parent
Preserve the existing functionality where SummaryCards display tab-specific metrics
Do not modify the backend or data fetching logic
nonGoals: Changing how orders are fetched from the backend
